title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that a ligand/chemical messenger, in this instance a hormone, binds to a receptor protein in a target cell.
The response indicates that a ligand/chemical messenger, in this instance a hormone, binds to a receptor protein in a target cell.

title: Part B (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response
descriptions: The response does not indicate that a dependent variable is the level of phosphorylated signaling protein OR the level of phosphorylated STAT5 OR the level of phosphorylated protein kinase B.
The response indicates that a dependent variable is the level of phosphorylated signaling protein OR the level of phosphorylated STAT5 OR the level of phosphorylated protein kinase B.

title: Part B (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that a negative control for the effects of hormone addition is the zero time point when hormone is added or adding no hormone or a denatured hormone to an identical culture and taking samples at the same time points.

The response indicates that a negative control for the effects of hormone addition is the zero time point when hormone is added or adding no hormone or a denatured hormone to an identical culture and taking samples at the same time points

title: Part B (iii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the response to the hormone might take some time to start OR that the researchers might have wanted to see how long a response to the hormone lasted.
The response indicates that the response to the hormone might take some time to start OR that the researchers might have wanted to see how long a response to the hormone lasted.

title: Part C (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that addition of insulin caused a high level of phosphorylated protein kinase B (about 80 percent of maximum) right to the end of the experiment at 240 minutes.
The response indicates that addition of insulin caused a high level of phosphorylated protein kinase B (about 80 percent of maximum) right to the end of the experiment at 240 minutes.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the data show that different signaling proteins are phosphorylated by the two different hormones, which supports the researchers’ claim.
The response indicates that the data show that different signaling proteins are phosphorylated by the two different hormones, which supports the researchers’ claim.
